name: Oscar Sanchez
headline: Founder & Community Builder | Building the AI Global Community | Connecting AI Leaders to Deploy Real-World Solutions
summary: I help teams ship governed GenAI that moves real KPIs.
I'm the founder of Gen AI Global and a Learning Facilitator with MIT Professional Education (Applied GenAI + Agentic AI).
I also co-founded AIforAll Global and Patrones Hermosos at MIT.
what_i_do: Turn GenAI capability into measurable workflow + product leverage.
Build governance + evaluations from day one (so pilots don't die in production).
Design agentic workflows with humans-in-the-loop, clear controls, and adoption that sticks.
how_i_work: Diagnose value + risk (what matters, what can break).
Pilot with measurement, consent, attribution, and review gates.
Ship to production and enable teams with repeatable patterns.

proof_selected.label: Gen AI Global
proof: Led with an AI-assisted operating system for content, events, and engagement.

proof_selected.label: Patrones Hermosos
proof: Scaled a national STEM program with Tec de Monterrey.
2,000+ students; 300+ U.S. instructors; 600+ Mexican TAs across 23 cities.

proof_selected.label: AIforAll Global
proof: Delivered masterclasses/bootcamps with ethics + misinformation built in.

proof_selected.label: Teaching
proof: Created a framing framework so students justify models with metrics and evidence, not vibes.

highlights: Founded and lead the Global Gen AI Professional Network (MIT Professional Education-backed).
Architected AI-enhanced community platform with bots and automations (content delivery, events, engagement, resource curation).
Orchestrated WhatsApp -> Discord model with weekly rituals and monthly roundtables.
Nonprofit building open standards for cognitive security as AI becomes a default collaborator.
Publishes playbooks for safe agent behavior, risk measurement templates, case studies, workshops, cohorts, and a standards-building community.
Supports working professionals in Applied Generative AI for Digital Transformation and Applied Agentic AI for Organizational Transformation.

experience.role: Applied Deep Learning Instructor & Curriculum Architect
highlights: Designed and taught "Applied Deep Learning (Browser-Only)" in Google Colab.
Built the 6-intake framing framework and POINTS rule/evidence pipeline.
Led labs on discriminative vs generative models, agentic vs generative systems, RAG chains, and validation-first coding.
Design and lead the AI Changemakers Fellowship.
Build global partnerships; mentor youth-led AI projects; run showcases; develop open tools and curricula.
Interdisciplinary initiative for women's STEM education in computational fields; scaled to 10,000+ annual participants across U.S. and Mexico.
Built data-driven curriculum with practical design patterns.
Secured partnerships with MIT, MISTI, and Tecnologico de Monterrey.

experience.org: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard
highlights: Developed interactive web interfaces and a custom JS library to streamline genomic data analysis.
Engineered a Node.js application for dynamic query visualization.
Created and delivered computational thinking workshops for visually impaired/blind students.
Translated algorithmic principles into accessible lessons.

education.program: Applied Agentic AI for Organizational Transformation
Applied Generative AI for Digital Transformation

education.org: Isenberg School of Management, UMass Amherst
